Journal Story: Tomorrow Wendy and I will drive to Dahlonega to stay overnight there before starting at Springer on Tuesday. I'm getting the last minute details in place.

We are staying in Dahlonega tonight. It's about an hour drive to the parking area that's on FS road 42, about one mile north of Springer. Bill and IÂ are going to slack-pack the mile south to the top of Springer, then pick up our packs when we get back to the parking area. We decided to skip the approach trail. Bill has done it before, and I'm choosing not to do it because of the stairs. IÂ don't have much interest in that.Â Bill is using my old Lowe Alpine pack, and when we were fitting it to him tonight, the waist strap buckle broke. I ran to Walmart and got the last repair kit off the hook to fix it. Very lucky they had it. His pack is ready to go.Â Breakfast tomorrow at 7, on the trail at 9. One mile up to Springer, then the same mile back, then we will go north about 8 more miles.Â I'll be keeping my mileage low for the first couple of weeks to keep from getting any overuse injury right off the bat.Â I'll miss sharing this with Wendy full-time, but will keep her posted as IÂ go along, hopefully finding a place daily where we can talk.

I started early this morning, around 7. I was alone on the trail for the first few miles. The woods was quiet except for a few birds and the sloshing of my boots in the mud. It has been raining off and on since I started on Tuesday. Iâ€™ve gone about 8 miles per day. I hadnâ€™t planned to do more than that for about the first week. I want to keep from getting an overuse type of injury early on. I think that Iâ€™ve gotten through the â€œwhat the heck am I doingâ€ phase and now getting into the flow. Iâ€™m staying tonight in a cabin that a few other hikers are sharing. That way I can get a shower and sleep in a dry spot. Itâ€™s funny how some normal things seem like such a treat when you donâ€™t have them all the time. Iâ€™ll post again in a couple days where I should have good phone service again.

Hi Everyone, I have had a great week on the AT, but I have just gotten off the trail for some time, maybe a couple weeks. Wendy is concerned about the social implications of the corona virus and wants me to be home for a bit so she will be more comfortable with the situation. She fully supports me being on the trail, but she is the most important part of my life, and the trail will always be there. I plan to return to the AT as soon as possible. I appreciate everyone's expressions of congratulations and support for my start, and I will be providing an update when I return to the trail.
I am turning off my location tracking app but will start it again when Iâ€™m back to hiking.
I hope everyone takes this time to draw closer to family and friends and to help others as they can.

I am sad that Iâ€™ll be coming off the trail tomorrow, probably for good. I have developed a foot problem called Mortonâ€™s Neuroma. Iâ€™ve had one in my right foot for several years and have treated it using superfeet insoles and felt pads that are made for it.
